FuncDef:
The nat64 ip access-user limit command sets the maximum number of private network users sharing the same public IP address in PAT mode.
The undo nat64 ip access-user limit command deletes the maximum number of private network users sharing the same public IP address in PAT mode.
By default, the number of private network users sharing the same public IP address in PAT mode is not limited.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of private network users sharing the same public IP address.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4096.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is mainly used in dynamic port allocation and per-port allocation scenarios where multiple private network users use the same public IP address for access.One public IP address can be shared by multiple private network users. If the available ports are insufficient for the number of private network users, the traffic of some private network users fails to be forwarded. The limit helps a device evenly map private IP addresses to public IP addresses, which prevent excess users from sharing the same IP address. To set the maximum number of private network users sharing the same public IP address, run the nat64 ip access-user limit command.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E.
